private_information: Expert in STRIPS-style action modeling and predicate normalization
Ensures clean, canonical action signatures and predicate vocabularies
Will not emit PDDL; only produces an action schema description usable by downstream agents
domain_modeler.goal: Produce a precise, ambiguity-free action schema from the public description of actions, preconditions, and effects.

private_information: Expert at grounding natural language initial states and goals into normalized predicate instances
Determines the object universe per case and consolidates duplicates
Will not emit PDDL; only produces grounded state sets for each case
state_grounder.goal: Ground the two cases (initial states and goals) into normalized sets of facts and objects using the action schema.

private_information: Checks temporal and causal consistency of given plans under STRIPS semantics
Computes precondition satisfaction, applies add/delete effects, and reports mismatches
Will not emit PDDL; only produces a validation report and identified flaws or confirmations
plan_validator.goal: Validate the provided plan for Case A against the grounded state and action schema and report any issues; prepare constraints for Case B planning.

private_information: Audits temporal and causal consistency across agents' outputs
Removes bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties
Flags hidden assumptions and ensures that all preconditions are justified by prior effects or initial state
consistency_auditor.goal: Produce an audit report ensuring there are no causal loopholes or bookkeeping shortcuts across the schema, grounded states, and plan validation.

private_information: Coordinates multi-agent information into a final planning artifact
Produces a final PDDL domain and problems suitable for the Fast Downward (FastDownwards) solver
Keeps agent contributions distinct and traceable in comments
orchestrator.goal: Integrate all analyses and produce a final PDDL domain and two PDDL problems (Case A and Case B) targeting the Fast Downward solver.

cases: Case A has an initial plan provided for validation

public_information: Domain overview: Actions are Paltry(o0,o1,o2), Sip(o0,o1,o2), Clip(o0,o1,o2), Wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3), Memory(o0,o1,o2), Tightfisted(o0,o1,o2). Predicates: hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, collect.
Action Paltry(o0,o1,o2): Preconditions = hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2. Add effects = next o0 o2. Delete effects = vase o0 o1.
Action Sip(o0,o1,o2): Preconditions = hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2. Add effects = vase o0 o1. Delete effects = next o0 o2.
Action Clip(o0,o1,o2): Preconditions = hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2. Add effects = vase o0 o1. Delete effects = next o0 o2.
Action Wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3): Preconditions = sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3. Add effects = next o0 o2. Delete effects = next o0 o1.
Action Memory(o0,o1,o2): Preconditions = cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1. Add effects = next o0 o2. Delete effects = next o0 o1.
Action Tightfisted(o0,o1,o2): Preconditions = hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1. Add effects = next o0 o2. Delete effects = vase o0 o1.

Case A initial state: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_10 object_3; collect object_11 object_3; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_12; hand object_13; next object_0 object_9; next object_1 object_9; next object_12 object_11; next object_13 object_7; next object_4 object_8; next object_5 object_11; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_9; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_10; texture object_11; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Case A goal: next object_12 object_10 and next object_13 object_9.

Case A plan to validate: clip object_12 object_5 object_11; wretched object_5 object_11 object_10 object_3; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_10; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; clip object_13 object_4 object_7; wretched object_4 object_7 object_6 object_2; tightfisted object_13 object_4 object_6; memory object_1 object_9 object_6; sip object_13 object_1 object_6; memory object_1 object_6 object_9; paltry object_13 object_1 object_9.

Case B initial state: cats object_0; collect object_10 object_2; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_1; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_2; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_13; next object_0 object_8; next object_11 object_10; next object_12 object_6; next object_13 object_9; next object_3 object_7; next object_4 object_10; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_8; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_10; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Case B goal: next object_11 object_8 and next object_12 object_8 and next object_13 object_10.

Modeling guidance: Treat all predicates as boolean and actions as STRIPS operators with add and delete lists. No numeric fluents, no derived predicates beyond what is implied, and no bookkeeping shortcuts.

extract_schema.system_prompt: You are the domain_modeler. From the public information, produce a clean, canonical STRIPS action schema (names, parameters, preconditions, add effects, delete effects) and a normalized predicate inventory. Do not emit PDDL; produce a precise, unambiguous schema description only.
extract_schema.prompt: Your task is to read the action descriptions and produce a normalized action schema and predicate list with consistent parameter naming and arity. Ensure no hidden assumptions are introduced. Public information: {environment->public_information}.

ground_cases.system_prompt: You are the state_grounder. Using the action schema, ground the two cases' initial states and goals into explicit sets of facts and derive the object universe used in each case. Do not emit PDDL.
ground_cases.prompt: Normalize object names, consolidate duplicates, and output for each case: objects, initial facts, and goal facts. Validate that all facts use known predicates and arities. Use this input schema: {action_schema}. Public information: {environment->public_information}.

validate_plan.system_prompt: You are the plan_validator. Validate the provided Case A plan with a forward simulation under STRIPS semantics. Report stepwise precondition checks, resulting states, and any violations. Do not emit PDDL.
validate_plan.prompt: Using the action schema and grounded Case A state, simulate each plan step, verifying preconditions and applying add/delete effects. Identify unsupported preconditions, unreachable steps, or contradictions. Also extract constraints and hints that could help synthesize a plan for Case B. Inputs: {action_schema}, {grounded_cases}.

audit.system_prompt: You are the consistency_auditor. Audit the schema, grounded states, and validation report for temporal/causal consistency. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts (quota tokens, post-hoc penalties) and flag hidden assumptions.
audit.prompt: Ensure all preconditions are causally supported by initial facts or prior effects. Check that deletes are respected and there is no reuse of deleted facts without re-establishment. Produce a concise audit report including any required corrections. Inputs: {action_schema}, {grounded_cases}, {plan_assessment}.

compile_pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Produce the final PDDL domain and two PDDL problems (Case A and Case B) targeting the Fast Downward (FastDownwards) solver. Keep actions consistent with the provided schema, include all required objects and predicates, and encode initial states and goals as grounded facts. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Provide content compatible with Fast Downward.
compile_pddl.prompt: Integrate the action schema, grounded states, validation insights, and audit corrections to produce one domain and two problems. Include clear object lists, predicate declarations, and STRIPS operators. Ensure Case A reflects the provided initial state and goals and Case B reflects its initial state and goals. Make no new assumptions beyond audited content. Inputs: {action_schema}, {grounded_cases}, {plan_assessment}, {audit_report}.
